get.description: Returns a list of your ApiTokens. The ApiTokens are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recent ApiTokens appearing first.

post.description: Creates a new ApiToken. The ApiToken is returned, including its `token` field, which you should record for future reference. **Be careful, this token is only returned once, when the token is created.**

get.description: Retrieve an ApiToken that has previously been created.

delete.description: Delete an ApiToken that has previously been created. Once deleted, the ApiToken can no longer be used to authenticate requests.

get.description: Returns a list of your Organizations. The Organizations are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recent Organizations appearing first.
Retrieve my Organization personal organization.
Retrieve an Organization that has previously been created.
Retrieves all the Users of an organizations.

post.summary: Update a User of an Organization
post.description: Updates an existing User of an Organization.

delete.summary: Delete a User from an Organization
delete.description: Remove an existing User from an Organization.

get.description: Returns a list of your Projects. The Projects are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recent Project appearing first.
Retrieve a Project that has previously been created.

get.summary: List all statistics for a given project
get.description: List all statistics for a given project.

schema.description: The month to filter the statistics.
The day to filter the statistics.

get.summary: List all Counters for a given project component
get.description: List all Counters for a given project component.

schema.description: The month to filter the counters.
The day to filter the counters.

get.description: Retrieves all the Domains of a project.

post.description: Creates a new Domain of a project.

get.description: Retrieve a Domain that has previously been created.

get.summary: List Proxy Settings revisions of a project
get.description: Retrieves all the Proxy Settings revisions of a project.

200.description: The list of all the Proxy Settings revisions

post.summary: Update a ProxySettings by its revision number

get.description: Retrieves all the Components of a project.

post.description: Creates a new Component for a project.

get.summary: Get a Component of a project
get.description: Retrieve a Project Component that has previously been set up.

post.description: Purge the cache for a specific project. You can purge all cache or purge cache for a specific path. When purging by path, the cache for all domains associated with the project will be purged for that path.

get.description: Returns a list of public components.
Retrieve a Component by Uuid.

put.description: Updates an existing Component by Uuid.

delete.description: Delete an existing Component by Uuid.

get.description: Retrieve a Component by Slug.

put.description: Updates an existing Component by Slug.

delete.description: Delete an existing Component by Slug.

post.summary: Create a Component Version by Slug
post.description: Create a Component Version by Slug.

put.summary: Update a Component Version by Slug
put.description: Update a Component Version by Slug.

get.description: Returns a list of organization components.
Returns a list of the invitation of your organizations. The Invitations are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recent Invitation appearing first.
Retrieve an Invitation that has previously been created.
Retrieves my current User object.
Retrieve a User that has previously been created.

post.description: Update a User that has previously been created.

get.summary: List all Incoming Data Collection Events
get.description: Retrieves all the Incoming Data Collection Events of a project.

200.description: A list of Incoming Data Collection Events

get.summary: List all Outgoing Data Collection Events
get.description: Retrieves all the Outgoing Data Collection Events of a project.

200.description: A list of Outgoing Data Collection Events

schema.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned.

A cursor for use in pagination. `start_key` parameter defines the place in the list for your subsequent calls. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, the last one having `ABCDE` key, you can make a subsequent call with `start_key=ABCDE` in order to fetch the next page of the list.

The order direction of the returned list. Objects are returned sorted by creation date. By default, the order is descending, so the most recent object appears first. Possible values are ASC and DESC. Default is DESC.

ApiToken.description: An ApiToken is a unique identifier that you can use to authenticate requests to the API. You can create as many ApiTokens as you need.

object.description: String representing the objects type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

id.description: This is the internal ID for this ApiToken. You dont need to record this information, since you will not need to use it.

user_id.description: The ID of the user that created this ApiToken.

from_browser.description: Whether this ApiToken was created from the browser.

last_used_at.description: The last time this ApiToken was used.

created_at.description: Time at which the object was created.

updated_at.description: Time at which the object was last updated.

token.description: The actual token that you will use to authenticate your requests. > **Be careful, this token is only returned once, when the token is created.**

object.description: String representing the objects type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

id.description: The unique identifier for the organization.

created_at.description: Time at which the object was created.

updated_at.description: Time at which the object was last updated.

ProjectBase.description: A Project is a unique identifier that you can use to manage and organize your work. Each project belongs to an organization.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value

organization_id.description: Unique identifier for the organization the project belongs to

slug.description: The Name of the project, URL-friendly string that identifies the project

created_at.description: Time at which the project was created

updated_at.description: Time at which the project was last updated

external_project_url.description: External link to a platform provider for the project

ProjectBaseWithoutOrgId.description: A Project is a unique identifier that you can use to manage and organize your work. Each project belongs to an organization.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value

slug.description: The Name of the project, URL-friendly string that identifies the project

created_at.description: Time at which the project was created

updated_at.description: Time at which the project was last updated

ProjectFull.description: A Project is a unique identifier that you can use to manage and organize your work. Each project belongs to an organization.

log_severity.description: The log severity of the project.

edgee_behind_proxy_cache.description: Whether the project is behind a proxy cache (or CDN).

force_https.description: Whether the project is forcing HTTPS.

cache.description: Whether caching is enabled for the project.

override_cache.description: List of cache rules that override the default cache settings.

override_cache_enabled.description: Whether the cache override is enabled.

cookie_name.description: The name of the cookie that edgee will use to store the session ID.

cookie_domain.description: The domain of the cookie that edgee will use to store the session ID.

proxy_only.description: Whether the Edgee will only proxy requests to the origin without any computing.

proxy_only_path_regex.description: A regular expression that matches the path of the request to be proxied only.

inject_sdk.description: Whether Edgee should inject the SDK into the html content.

inject_sdk_position.description: The position of the SDK injection.

cookieless.description: Whether the Edgee should use a cookieless session.

autocapture.description: Configuration for automatic event capture by the Edgee SDK.

pageview.description: Whether to automatically capture pageview events

spa_pageview.description: Whether to automatically capture single page app pageview events

engagement.description: Whether to automatically capture engagement events

click.description: Whether to automatically capture click events

form.description: Whether to automatically capture form events

scroll.description: Whether to automatically capture scroll events

enforce_no_store_policy.description: A boolean that indicates whether Edgee should enforce a `no-store` cache-control header on the responses that can be computed.

trusted_ips.description: List of trusted IPs that can access the project.

password_protection.description: Whether the project is password protected.

blocked_ips.description: List of blocked IPs that can't access the project. Blocking IPs can only works is trusted_ips and password_protection are empty.

cookie_whitelist.description: List of cookies that are allowed to be set by the project.

forwarded_headers.description: List of headers that are forwarded to the origin.

rate_limiting.description: List of rate limiting rules for the project.

rate_limiting_enabled.description: Whether rate limiting is enabled for the project.

CacheRule.description: A CacheRule is a rule that overrides the default cache settings.

id.description: The project ID (required, must be a valid UUID)

path.description: Optional path to purge cache for. If not provided, all cache will be purged. Query strings are automatically removed from the path.

override_cache.description: Whether to purge override cache instead of main cache. Defaults to false.

RateLimitingRule.description: A RateLimitingRule defines a rate limiting rule for the project.

rank.description: The rank of the rule. Rules are evaluated in order of rank (lowest first).

limit.description: Maximum requests per second within the rate window.

block_duration.description: Duration to block the client if rate limit is exceeded (in seconds).

key.description: Criteria to include in the client key for rate limiting.

conditions.description: Conditions that must be met for this rule to apply.

path.description: Path pattern to match. Can be exact path or regex pattern.

regex.description: Whether the path is a regex pattern.

method.description: HTTP methods that this rule applies to.

continent.description: Continents that this rule applies to.

country.description: Countries (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes) that this rule applies to.

terms_version.description: The Terms version accepted by the user.

privacy_version.description: The Privacy version accepted by the user.

Domain.description: A Domain is a hostname that you can use to access your project. Each domain belongs to a project.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value

dns_status.description: The DNS status of the domain.

ssl_status.description: The SSL status of the domain.

created_at.description: Time at which the object was created.

updated_at.description: Time at which the object was last updated.

dns_status.description: The DNS status of the domain.

ssl_status.description: The SSL status of the domain.

ProxySettings.description: A ProxySettings is a revision of the proxy settings of a project.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value

revision.description: The revision number of the proxy settings.

description.description: Description of the proxy settings revision.

is_active.description: Whether this revision is the active one.

backends.description: The backend list of the proxy.

routes.description: The routing rules of the proxy.

description.description: Description of the proxy settings revision.

backends.description: The backend list of the proxy.

routes.description: The routing rules of the proxy.

description.description: Description of the proxy settings revision.

is_active.description: Whether this revision is the active one.

name.description: A string that represents the name of the backend.

address.description: A string that represents the address of the backend.

enable_ssl.description: A boolean that indicates that SSL should be enabled for this backend.

check_certificate.description: An optional string that, if present, represents the hostname that the server certificate should declare, and turn on validation during backend connections. You should enable this if you are using SSL/ TLS, and setting this will enable SSL for the connection as a side effect.

ca_certificate.description: An optional string that, if present, represents the CA certificate for this backend. Set the CA certificate to use when checking the validity of the backend. Setting this will enable SSL for the connection as a side effect.

sni_hostname.description: An optional string that, if present, represents the SNI hostname for this backend. Setting this will enable SSL for the connection as a side effect.

default.description: An optional boolean that, if present and set to `true`, indicates that this backend is the default backend.

override_host.description: An optional string that, if present, represents the host that should be overridden for this backend. This will force the value of the "Host" header to the given string when sending out the origin request. If this is not set and no header already exists, the "Host" header will default to this backend's address.

path.description: A string that represents the path for which this rule applies. This can be a regular expression if `regex` is set to `true`.

regex.description: A boolean that indicates whether the `path` is a regular expression.

backend_name.description: The name of the backend to which requests that match this rule should be routed.

rank.description: An integer that represents the rank of this rule. Rules with lower ranks are evaluated before rules with higher ranks.

continent.description: An optional vector of strings that represent the continents associated with an IP address. If this is set, the rule only applies to requests from IP addresses in the specified continents.

region.description: An optional vector of strings that represent the general regions of the world in which the Fastly POP processing the current Compute instance resides. If this is set, the rule only applies to requests from the specified regions.

country.description: An optional vector of strings that represent the countries associated with an IP address. If this is set, the rule only applies to requests from IP addresses in the specified countries.

ProjectComponent.description: A Project Component object represents an integration of a component in a project.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value

id.description: Unique identifier for the project component

active.description: Whether the component is active in the project

Component.description: A component is a reusable piece of code that can be used in multiple projects.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value

versions.description: List of versions of the component

repo_link.description: Link to the repository of the component

documentation_link.description: Link to the documentation of the component

created_at.description: Time at which the project was created

updated_at.description: Time at which the project was last updated

is_public.description: Whether the component is public or not

is_archived.description: Whether the component is archived or not

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value

wit_world_version.description: Wit world version of the component

created_at.description: Time at which the component version item was created

name.description: The name of the configuration field.

title.description: The title of the configuration field.

type.description: The type of the configuration field.

options.description: The options of the configuration field (only for string type).

required.description: Whether the configuration field is required.

description.description: The description of the configuration field.

secret.description: Whether the configuration field is a secret.

documentation_link.description: Link to the documentation of the component.

repo_link.description: Link to the repository of the component.

public.description: Whether the created component is public or not.

documentation_link.description: Link to the documentation of the component.

repo_link.description: Link to the repository of the component.

is_archived.description: Whether the component is archived or not.

public.description: Whether the component is public or not.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value

Invitation.description: An invitation is a request to join an organization. An invitation is sent to an email address, and the recipient can accept or decline the invitation.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value

organization_id.description: Unique identifier for the organization the project belongs to

role.description: The future role of the user in the organization.

created_at.description: Time at which the project was created

UserBase.description: A User is a unique identifier that you can use to manage and organize your work.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value

created_at.description: Time at which the project was created

updated_at.description: Time at which the project was last updated

User.description: A User is a unique identifier that you can use to manage and organize your work.

additionalProperties.description: The role of the user in each organization.

roles.description: Roles of the user in multiple organizations. The keys are organization IDs, and values are roles ('admin', 'editor', 'member').

role.description: The role of the user in the organization.

IncomingDataCollectionEvent.description: An incoming data collection event is an event created by edgee, which will be processed and transformed into one or more outgoing data collection events by the components.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value

timestamp.description: Time at which the event was created

OutgoingDataCollectionEvent.description: An outgoing data collection event is an event created by a component, which will be sent to the destination specified by the component.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value

component_request.description: Object representing the request of the event

component_response.description: Object representing the response of the event

limit.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned.

start_key.description: A cursor for use in pagination. `start_key` parameter defines the place in the list for your subsequent calls. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, the last one having `ABCDE` key, you can make a subsequent call with `start_key=ABCDE` in order to fetch the next page of the list.

order_direction.description: The order direction of the returned list. Objects are returned sorted by creation date. By default, the order is descending, so the most recent object appears first. Possible values are ASC and DESC. Default is DESC.

object.description: String representing the objects type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

url.description: The URL where this list can be accessed.

has_more.description: Whether there are more objects beyond the ones returned. You can use it to decide whether to show the user a load more button, for example.

last_key.description: The last key of the list. You can use its value on the `start_key` parameter to fetch the next page of the list.

object.description: String representing the objects type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

id.description: This is the internal ID for this object. You dont need to record this information, since you will not need to use it.

deleted.description: If the object has been deleted, the value is true. If the object has not been deleted, the value is false.

ErrorResponse.description: An error response from the API. More info [here]('/docs/api-reference/errors')

message.description: A human-readable message providing more details about the error.

params.description: The specific request parameters associated with the error. May be omitted if the error message is generic enough to apply to multiple parameters.

param.description: The parameter related to the error.

message.description: A human-readable message providing more details about the error.

ProjectCounters.description: A Project Counters object represents the statistics of a project.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value

request_count.description: The number of requests made to the project.

event_count.description: The number of events made to the project.

ProjectComponentCounters.description: A Project Counters object represents the counters of a project.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value

user_count.description: The number of user events generated by the component.

track_count.description: The number of track events generated by the component.

page_count.description: The number of page events generated by the component.

bearerAuth.description: Bearer authentication header of the form `Bearer <token>`, where `<token>` is your auth token. More info [here]('/docs/api-reference/authentication')
